poem:
Title: "In Pursuit of Peace"

On a plane to The Hague she rides,   
Pandor weaving through the clouds,  
With justice humming in her stride.  
A hopeful heart in the court's shrouds.

Genocide accusations fill the air,  
An interim ruling, their only prayer.  
May a ceasefire with morning dew pair,  
In Gaza, let bloom not despair,  
But peace's lonesome bloom, rare and fair.
